page.title: 09HOUSING
page.content: We went to the estate agents to interview them for the Domesday Project. We asked many questions. The most popular time of the year for people to buy houses is in May _ the sale takes two and a half months _ and then the people like to move in the summer. Estate agents do not sell caravans. One estate agent sells around fifteen to twenty houses a month.An average price of a house is Â£40,000; but it can range up to Â£1,000000 for a really big old manor house. The price of a house includes its grounds and any extras it may have, such as swimming pool or tennis courts. Housing varies from medieval or 19th. century terraces to modern semi-detached or detached residences or small blocks of flats; but it is all built in brick.
